issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: The product is working as designed.
resolution.name: Not a Bug

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
After running around 500 instances in 1 security group by starting then stopping   8 instances at a time. I see the following left over bridge interfaces with all instances terminated. Found in maint/3.1/testing 85e26089:

[root@eucahost-51-88 ~]# euca-describe-instances 
[root@eucahost-51-88 ~]# euca-describe-group
GROUP   071244981923    default default group
PERMISSION      071244981923    default ALLOWS  icmp    -1      -1      FROM    CIDR    0.0.0.0/0
GROUP   071244981923    BonnieChurnGroup        BonnieChurnGroup
PERMISSION      071244981923    BonnieChurnGroup        ALLOWS  tcp     22      22      FROM    CIDR    0.0.0.0/0
PERMISSION      071244981923    BonnieChurnGroup        ALLOWS  icmp    0       0       FROM    CIDR    0.0.0.0/0
[root@eucahost-51-88 ~]# brctl show
bridge name     bridge id               STP enabled     interfaces
eucabr103               8000.000000000000       no
eucabr104               8000.000000000000       no
eucabr110               8000.000000000000       no
eucabr111               8000.000000000000       no
eucabr114               8000.000000000000       no
eucabr117               8000.000000000000       no
eucabr120               8000.000000000000       no
eucabr122               8000.000000000000       no
eucabr30                8000.000000000000       no
eucabr35                8000.000000000000       no
eucabr36                8000.000000000000       no
eucabr40                8000.000000000000       no
eucabr47                8000.000000000000       no
eucabr50                8000.000000000000       no
eucabr58                8000.000000000000       no
eucabr75                8000.000000000000       no
eucabr79                8000.000000000000       no
eucabr87                8000.000000000000       no
eucabr99                8000.000000000000       no
[root@eucahost-51-88 ~]#

comments.body:
Vic,

The CC/NC currently leave bridge devices allocated since teardown can be expensive (and, on certain kernels, we have experienced oopses if there is lots of 'churn' WRT bridge creation/deletion).  We've done some performance testing and have found no evidence (not 100% conclusive, but have not yet found) that leaving bridge devices allocated causes a performance or stability issue.

Please re-open if you have found evidence of performance/stability (or other) problems experienced by this effect!

D

I am running 3.2.1-devel and I keep running into this issue on the CC and NC.  After about 10 iterations of launching/terminating 3+ instances every iteration, network traffic no longer is able to get to the instances. Bridge interfaces are up, but traffic is not getting to the instances. In order to get the system back working correctly, I have to terminate the instances, remove the bridges, reboot the NCs and CC. Information below:

{code}
[root@viking-01 ~]# euca-describe-instances 
RESERVATION	r-04914288	345590850920	neo4j-cluster
INSTANCE	i-53E944BC	emi-C1613E67	euca-192-168-55-101.wu-tang.euca-hasp.eucalyptus-systems.com	euca-10-106-136-240.wu-tang.internal	running	neo4j	0		m1.large	2013-01-29T19:25:51.364Z	enter-the-wu	eki-0F3937E9	eri-0BE53BFD		monitoring-disabled	192.168.55.101	10.106.136.240			instance-store									
INSTANCE	i-B4B24004	emi-C1613E67	euca-192-168-55-105.wu-tang.euca-hasp.eucalyptus-systems.com	euca-10-106-136-242.wu-tang.internal	running	neo4j	2		m1.large	2013-01-29T19:25:51.541Z	enter-the-wu	eki-0F3937E9	eri-0BE53BFD		monitoring-disabled	192.168.55.105	10.106.136.242			instance-store									
INSTANCE	i-FC31408F	emi-C1613E67	euca-192-168-55-104.wu-tang.euca-hasp.eucalyptus-systems.com	euca-10-106-136-250.wu-tang.internal	running	neo4j	1		m1.large	2013-01-29T19:25:51.457Z	enter-the-wu	eki-0F3937E9	eri-0BE53BFD		monitoring-disabled	192.168.55.104	10.106.136.250			instance-store									
[root@viking-01 ~]# ssh -i creds/neo4j.priv ubuntu@euca-192-168-55-101.wu-tang.euca-hasp.eucalyptus-systems.com
[root@viking-01 ~]# ssh -i creds/neo4j.priv ubuntu@euca-192-168-55-101.wu-tang.euca-hasp.eucalyptus-systems.com
[root@viking-01 ~]# ping euca-192-168-55-101.wu-tang.euca-hasp.eucalyptus-systems.com
PING euca-192-168-55-101.wu-tang.euca-hasp.eucalyptus-systems.com (192.168.55.101) 56(84) bytes of data.
^C
--- euca-192-168-55-101.wu-tang.euca-hasp.eucalyptus-systems.com ping statistics ---
3 packets transmitted, 0 received, 100% packet loss, time 2480ms
{code}

[root@viking-03 ~]# ps aux | grep dhcpd
root     16529  0.0  0.0  44348  1532 ?        Ss   11:25   0:00 /usr/sbin/dhcpd41 -cf //var/run/eucalyptus/net/euca-dhcp.conf -lf //var/run/eucalyptus/net/euca-dhcp.leases -pf //var/run/eucalyptus/net/euca-dhcp.pid -tf //var/run/eucalyptus/net/euca-dhcp.trace eucabr1097 em2

[root@viking-03 ~]# cat /var/run/eucalyptus/net/euca-dhcp.conf

# virsh list
 Id    Name                           State
----------------------------------------------------

Let me know if you would like any additional information.

Regards,

Harold Spencer, Jr.
[~hspencer] how does this failure relate to the original bug here? I believe your issue is unrelated to left over bridge interfaces.

[~viglesias],

Yes it does from what I can tell.  Instance traffic is just fine for around 8-9 iterations.  I will then launch instances after I have terminated the previous ones, and traffic is no longer available to those instances.  For all interactions, I am using the same image as well. In respect to this bug, it looks like it is a performance issue. Instance traffic working, then stops working after a few run/terminate instance cycles. Let me know if you need any additional information.

-H
Was behaving as expected per Dan's comment. If connectivity/performance issues persist we can open a new issue to deal with those in the current code.
